article:
In computer graphics, a 'sample' is an intersection of channel and a
pixel. [http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#3sample W3C Sample Definition]

The diagram below depicts a 24-bit pixel, consisting of 3 samples for Red,
Green, and Blue.



In this particular diagram, the Red sample occupies 9 bits, the Green sample
occupies 7 bits and the Blue sample occupies 8 bits, totaling 24 bits per pixel.
Note that the samples do not have to be equal size and not all samples are
mandatory in a pixel.

Also, a pixel can consist of more than 3 samples (e.g. 4 samples of the RGBA
color space).

A sample is related to a subpixel on a physical display.
